Value: Human-Created Surface Waters Increase Suitability And Connectivity for River Otters (Lontra canadensis) in Texas

GitHub repository: https://github.com/tywerdel/RiverOtterSDM
Zenodo archive: DOI to be added upon publication
Continuous habitat suitability index (cloglog scale), binary suitability maps, and derived connectivity metrics
≈ 0.1 km (native raster resolution); watershed summaries at HUC-8

River otter habitat suitability increases with proximity to surface water and with higher densities of water features. Anthropogenic water features reduce landscape resistance and increase inter-watershed connectivity beyond what is expected from natural hydrology alone.

Species are assumed to be at quasi-equilibrium with contemporary hydrological conditions. Detection errors and misidentification in GBIF records are assumed to be low after filtering. Presence-only data are assumed to represent realized distribution constrained by accessibility to water.
Model complexity: Default Maxent feature classes and regularization settings were retained to avoid overfitting and to ensure comparability between contemporary and natural-only hydrology scenarios.

Occurrence records were filtered, spatially thinned, and intersected with hydrological predictor rasters. Maxent models were tuned using k-fold cross-validation and applied to generate continuous suitability predictions under contemporary and natural-only hydrology scenarios. Predictions were thresholded using an omission-based criterion. Suitability surfaces were transformed into resistance layers and summarized at the watershed (HUC-8) scale to compare connectivity and accessibility between scenarios.

Not applied; limited predictor set chosen a priori
Not applicable (no temporal or geographic transfer beyond study area)
Predictors were selected a priori based on ecological relevance.
Multicollinearity was minimized by using conceptually distinct hydrological predictors.

maxent: featureSet (Linear, quadratic, hinge), featureRule (Automatically determined by sample size (Maxent defaults)), regularizationMultiplierSet (1.0), regularizationRule (Default Maxent regularization to balance model fit and complexity), convergenceThresholdSet (Default), samplingBiasRule (No explicit bias surface applied)
Predictions were restricted to the environmental space of the study area; no explicit extrapolation or clamping beyond observed environmental ranges was applied.
Model coefficients were summarized using absolute beta values.
Summed absolute coefficients (Σ|β|) by predictor group.
Best-performing model selected based on cross-validated AUC and omission rates.
Spatial thinning applied to reduce spatial autocorrelation.
Omit-10% training presence threshold applied to cloglog predictions.
Response curves and spatial predictions were visually inspected for ecological realism.
